title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 November 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:44 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> good morning, cool I have a working POC for the new VFS module :)  
10:48 <cjd> VFS ?  
10:49 <vmassol> (there's also a thread on ML)  
10:49 <cjd> ahh right, zipexplorer  
10:49 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:50 <cjd> Nice  
10:59 <cjd> Random Thought:  Would be really neat if you could attach a "folder" instead of just a file  
10:59 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <cjd> of course maybe that ought to be implemented by creating an XWikiDocument per file  
11:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> you can attach a folder  
11:13 <vmassol> that works  
11:20 <vmassol> (since truevfs supports a File driver)  
11:20 <cjd> How does it store it ?  
11:20 <vmassol> I don't understand  
11:20 <vmassol> you're talknig about a folder  
11:20 <vmassol> a fodler is stored on the FS  
11:20 <vmassol> \*folder  
11:21 <cjd> 11:13 <@vmassol> you can attach a folder  <-- how does that work? How do you upload the thing? where does it put it and in what format ?  
11:21 <vmassol> including the File one  
11:21 <vmassol> "FILE, HTTP(S), ZIP, TAR and their relatives like JAR, TGZ, TBZ2 etc"  
11:21 <cjd> ok so you need to attach like a zip or targz  
11:21 <vmassol> no  
11:21 <vmassol> the HTTP one is external  
11:21 <vmassol> so is the FILE one  
11:22 <cjd> ok  
11:22 <vmassol> I've devleoped a custom driver  
11:22 <vmassol> ATTACH  
11:22 <cjd> how about FILEMANAGER ?  
11:22 <vmassol> which finds an archive located in a wiki page as an attachment  
11:22 <cjd> because that actually does have folders...  
11:22 <vmassol> yes the FileManager could probably be reimplement based on the vfs module  
11:23 <vmassol> (at some point)  
11:23 <Bugendolf> has quit  
11:23 <cjd> /nod  
11:23 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <vmassol> that would need a custom driver though if we wish to keep one page = one file  
11:24 <vmassol> anyway that's too early right now  
11:24 <vmassol> still at POC level right now  
11:24 <cjd> yup  
11:25 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <ClemensR1> has joined #xwiki

11:42 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:45 <mflorea> has quit  
11:45 <fcharton> has quit  
11:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <mflorea> vmassol: re "the FileManager could probably be reimplement based on the vfs module" you would loose the ability to attach meta data to the attached files (comments, annotations, access rights), for this you need to have an XWiki page for each file/folder (what the FileManager currently does)  
11:50 <vmassol> mflorea: you can have this with a custom driver  
11:50 <vmassol> custom vfs driver  
11:51 <mflorea> it looks too complex for me. There's also history, being able to write db queries, being able to search using Solr  
11:51 <vmassol> that doesn't change the store  
11:52 <vmassol> just the way to access it  
11:54 <vmassol> the idea would be to be able to plug a FM UI in xwiki for any VFS. But yes if you wish to have the search feature in your FM UI then you'll need to search using the NIO2 API  
11:55 <vmassol> but yes I agree it's complex  
11:55 <vmassol> and not sure about the real world use cases at this stage anyway :)  
12:20 <ClemensR1> Some recent user (admin) feedback: People really like the new feature to extend the menues via extension points in 7.3 :)
